#summary Ruby bindings

= Introduction =

The Ruby bindings are currently available as the [http://gemcutter.org/gems/selenium-webdriver selenium-webdriver] gem (on Gemcutter). The gem will be renamed to "selenium" and follow the major version numbers from the main project when Selenium 2.0 is released.

The bindings support Ruby 1.8.6 through 1.9.1 + JRuby. [http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/docs/api/rb/index.html API docs] are available.

= Details =

The bindings provide a slightly rubified version of the WebDriver API:

{{{
require "selenium-webdriver"

driver = Selenium::WebDriver.for :firefox
driver.navigate.to "http://google.com"

element = driver.find_element(:name, 'q')
element.send_keys "Hello WebDriver!"
element.submit

puts driver.title

driver.quit
}}}

The ruby bindings have drivers for Firefox, IE, Chrome + a client for the remote driver.

The `WebDriver.for()` call is a shortcut for 

{{{
Selenium::WebDriver::Driver.new(Selenium::WebDriver::Firefox::Bridge.new)
}}}

Any extra arguments pass to `for()` (besides the driver symbol) will be passed to the Bridge's constructor. So to configure the remote driver:

{{{
include Selenium

driver = WebDriver.for(:remote, :url                  => "http://localhost:6000/"
                                :desired_capabilities => WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities.firefox)
}}}
